title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Thursday, 10 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: roads across the county closed due to flooding .
former cambridge united player russell crane has died , the club says .
stephen hawking wants the uk to remain in the eu 'to protect science ' .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on friday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it for the day for everyone here at cambridgeshire local live .
we 'll be back tomorrow morning from 08:00 with all your news , sport , travel and weather updates .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : cambridge united legend dies cambridgeshire roads still affected by flooding
text: here are the main news stories making the news this evening :
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: film released by cambridgeshire police to get more people to report child sexual exploitation
text: a short film has been released by cambridgeshire police to highlight signs of child sexual exploitation .
as you can see it features the voice of an adolescent girl who refers to aspects of her relationship with her boyfriend as being exploitative , something she defends .

det sgt kath mccready said : if we talk openly about child sexual exploitation in schools , at home , with friends and those who care for young people , we can break the stigma associated with this type of crime . ''
author: Katharine Park
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: cambridgeshire mp calls for money to be spent on county 's roads
text: a cambridgeshire mp is calling on the government to do more to reduce noise pollution on the county 's roads .
peterborough mp stewart jackson wants part of a £ 75m roads investment strategy to be spent on the soke parkway in peterborough .
the transport minister robert goodwill insists the government is investing enough money to make sure noise pollution is reduced .
author: Hannah Olsson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire political reporter

documents.title: flooding delays bin collections in huntingdon area
text: a number of bins have been unable to be collected in the huntingdon area today because of flooding .

huntingdonshire district council says bins in chainbridge road in molesworth , polecat lane in alconbury and great north road in stibbington which were n't collected this morning may either be collected tomorrow or early next week .
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: weather : patchy fog and frost overnight
text: any patchy light rain in the west will soon die out this evening , leaving an otherwise dry night with some good cloud breaks at times , particularly in eastern parts such as ely .
there 'll be light winds throughout , allowing isolated mist or fog patches to develop and a patchy frost to form in places by dawn .
minimum temperature : 0c ( 32f ) .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: cambridgeshire roads still affected by floods
text: although the water is starting to subside , some roads are still affected by the flooding in cambridgeshire .
flooding : localised flooding remains in alconbury village , mill rd # buckden , brampton rd # huntingdon & b645 # tilbrook .
approach with care .

documents.title: russell crane a true gentleman
text: i was lucky enough to interview the cambridge united legend russell crane in 2012 , to mark 100 years of the club .
he was a true gentleman and he spoke so fondly of his times at the club .
he was a u 's man through and through .
russell crane reflects on his affinity with cambridge united - speaking with nick fairbairn back in 2012 : # cufc
author: Nick Fairbairn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: cambridge united remembers club legend russell crane
text: great image of russell crane being made honorary life-president of @ twitterid in november last year .

documents.title: cambridge united legend russell crane has died
text: former cambridge united forward russell crane has died , the club has said .
the u 's have paid tribute to the player who made over 400 appearances for the club between 1941 and 1959 and scored more than 150 goals .
they say they 're `` saddened '' by the death of the abbey legend , who was born in 1926 , and would like to pass on their condolences to his family .
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: breakingcambridge united legend dies
text: it 's just been announced by cambridge united that former player russell crane has died .

documents.title: eu referendum result in at cambridgeshire school
text: earlier we brought you the story of a cambridgeshire school running an eu referendum for school news report day .
as you can see the results are in and the pupils at witchford village college want to stay in the eu .
author: Johnny Dee
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: travel : four-vehicle crash on a14 by fenstanton
text: the a14 in fenstanton is partially blocked and there are long delays eastbound at j27 .
# a14 nr # fenstanton .
1 lane is closed e/b btwn j26 and j27 .
we 're assisting @ twitterid at a collision between 4 vehicles .

documents.title: fire service warns of adverting scam
text: a warning is being made by cambridgeshire fire and rescue that scammers could be operating in the county trying to get people to buy advertising for the fire service .
the force says it never sell advertising for anything like a magazine or a calendar and the call is not from them .
they add if anyone gets a call like this they should immediately contact cambridgeshire trading standards .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cambridgeshire pupils grill their headteacher
text: eager year nine 's at impington village college have been interviewing their executive principal , rob campbell as part of school report news day 2016 .
they 've been grilling him about school budgets and the house system .
thirty-five pupils at impington are taking part in the day that 's been set up so young people can report on stories that matter to and interest them .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: road closed till july for installation of traffic calming
text: a major road in cambridge will be shut for the next four months because of roadworks that have taken five years to plan and begin .
tenison road between mill road and st barnabas road is due to be closed until 3 july to allow traffic calming measures to be put in place .
diversions will be in place during the works and the city council has asked motorists to plan their routes until the road reopens .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: four sought over aggravated burglary at elderly woman 's home
text: jewellery and cash have been stolen from an elderly woman in cambridgeshire in what police have described as an `` aggravated burglary '' .
four masked men went into a property on isaacson road , burwell on monday evening between 21:30 and 22:30 .
one is believed to be in his 60s , the other three in their late teens or 20s .
anyone with information is being urged to contact police .
no details of the woman 's condition were given .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: weather : expected to brighten up later
text: this afternoon will see a rather cloudy start with perhaps the odd spot of rain or drizzle .
it will brighten up during the next couple of hours however , with sunny spells developing .
it will feel rather chilly in the northeasterly breeze , especially across great chishill .
maximum temperature : 10c ( 50f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: headlines : flooding causes road delays in cambridgeshire first cybercrime conference held in cambridgeshire
text: here are the headlines making the news this afternoon :
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: teenager sexually assaulted in peterborough
text: a 17-year-old girl has been sexually assaulted in peterborough .
cambridgeshire police says the incident happened at about 11:30 on wednesday , when she was approached from behind by a man and pulled into bushes close to stagsden in orton goldhay .
the man 's described as white and aged between 21 and 40 .
he is said to have been wearing a black jacket with a hood and jeans .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: health and safety event cancelled because of health and safety concerns
text: a health and safety event due to take place at huntingdon racecourse this morning was postponed because of health and safety concerns .

the session on complying with guidelines , organised by peninsula business services , had to be called off as roads leading up to and around the event were flooded , and there were fears people could get stranded .
david passfield , who was due to deliver the training , said he had to `` laugh at the irony of the situation '' .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: students hold their own eu referendum
text: forget the eu referendum that 's taking place on 23 june , i 've been finding out about one that 's being held in cambridgeshire today .
pupils at witchford village college have been asking their peers how they would vote , if of course they were old enough to vote .
it 's all part of school report news day .
we 'll bring you the result later .
author: Johnny Dee
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: travel : a14 one lane still closed
text: delays are still expected on the a14 as one lane remains closed westbound by brampton hut , because of flooding .
update : # a14 westbound still has one lane closed after j21 brampton hut due to flooding .
expect delays in the area .
@ twitterid @ twitterid chaos as hgv avoid a14 by using woolley road again

documents.title: four flood warnings in place in cambridgeshire
text: the environment agency says there are currently five flood warnings in place in cambridgeshire .

they include brampton , ellington , hamerton and the alconburys , the river kym from kimbolton to great staughton , north bank road alongside the river nene , east of peterborough and west of dog-in-a-doublet sluice and the lower nene .
it says five properties have been flooded in alconbury .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: peterborough recycling centre closed due to flooding
text: the household recycling centre in peterborough is closed today because of flooding .
i 've just been told it will remain shut until further notice , while the water levels drop .
the site is close to a drainage ditch .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: owner offers to pay for posh fans ' travel
text: a gesture of goodwill has been sent out by peterborough united owner darragh macanthony to posh fans who had planned to go to fleetwood on easter monday , after the match was rearranged .
those who can show travel plans prior to game being called off to the club a free seat on coaches i shall personally pay from my own pocket-
@ twitterid i hired a chartered private vip flight , can you refund me £ 50,000 ? ? ? ?
@ twitterid @ twitterid come off it macca you 're too tight to install heating : )
@ twitterid @ twitterid why do you need heating its practically summer
@ twitterid incredibly classy gesture .
gutted i cant make the rearranged fixture , but all at club been very compassionate in resolving issue .
@ twitterid top man
@ twitterid i can prove travel plans , but cant make the rearranged fixture .
anything doing there ?
@ twitterid great gesture
@ twitterid class act !
take note massimo !
@ twitterid not a beneficiary of this but what a great gesture !
@ twitterid do n't ever sell @ twitterid # topchairman
@ twitterid great generosity
@ twitterid come buy leeds
@ twitterid great gesture you and steve gibson doing the game proud !
@ twitterid well done darragh .
@ twitterid @ twitterid
@ twitterid great gesture proud to be posh .
@ twitterid i doubt there are that many , just another excuse to have yrt another pop at the club .
@ twitterid this guy is pure class
@ twitterid it 's on the sea front pal , throw in a fish supper too
@ twitterid and that 's why the real fans want you to stay regardless of promotion posh are a better club with you at the top # bestchairmanabout

documents.title: you need to register if you want to vote
text: it may be a couple of months until may , but if you want to vote in the forthcoming elections , then you need to register by monday 18 april to take part , the electoral commission says .
to register to vote you can visit the website .
and if you 're unsure as to whether you 're registered or not , or want to find out more about voting and taking part in the elections , then visit the voter information website .

documents.title: fire service says 'we wo n't tow you out of flood waters if you get stuck '
text: cambridgeshire fire and rescue is asking people to only call them with flooding problems if there 's a risk to life .
the service said it took 15 calls about flooding via its 999 number yesterday for issues that were n't an emergency .
station commander bruce parcell said : `` we would like to remind residents to only call 999 in a flooding situation if there is an immediate risk to life .
if you drive through flood water and get stuck , we will not tow your car out . ''
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : a1 flowing normally after earlier delays
text: it seems things are starting to get back to normal on cambridgeshire roads , after flooding caused parts of the a14 to be shut .
# a14 brampton hut .
from highways england , the wbc is now open and the # a1 is flowing normally .

documents.title: travel : a14 crash now cleared
text: there 's good news about the earlier accident on the a14 , westbound at junction 24 , which has now been cleared .
cleared : # a14 westbound at j24 godmanchester .
earlier delays have now cleared .

documents.title: firefighters help people stranded in floods
text: around 40 firefighters spent last night helping about 12 people leave their homes after flooding in alconbury and alconbury weston .
five fire engines , two rescue vehicles and a command unit were sent to the area after reports came in that vulnerable people were stuck in their homes .
seven dogs and two cats were also rescued .

documents.title: travel : crash on the a14
text: there 's been a crash on the a14 , westbound by junction 24 .
delays are expected .
# a14 westbound at j24 godmanchester .
incident .
expect delays .

documents.title: roads remain closed in cambridgeshire due to floods
text: this is a photo taken by one of our weather watchers , blackbird of bury , showing a stream that has been turned into an inland lake .
flooding has closed several roads in the the county , including the a14 , and in hamerton village , alconbury , tlibrook , kimbolton , stonely and great staughton .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: travel : one lane of closed a14 opens
text: one lane of the a14 westbound at junction 21 has just reopened , having closed because of flooding .
update : # a14 westbound at j21 brampton hut .
one lane has reopened .
entry slip at j20 ellington remains closed .

documents.title: travel : floods bring congestion on roads surrounding a14 and a1
text: floods on the a14 between j21 for brampton hut and j19 at easton are causing major disruption on surrounding roads , with westbound traffic backing up to the a141 at huntingdon .
roads are also becoming clogged along the diversion on the a1 north to peterborough , and then south on the a605 to thrapston .
more details on bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: stephen hawking wants the uk to remain in the eu 'to protect science '
text: stephen hawking has backed the campaign for britain to remain in the european union .
the cambridge university professor said in a letter to the times that leaving the eu would be a `` disaster for uk science '' , because many young scientists are now recruited from europe .
the referendum is to be held on 23 june .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: travel : roads closed at kimbolton
text: there 's traffic disruption in kimbolton due to flooding , with the b645 closed in both directions between the b660 junction and station road .
more details on bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: travel : a14 westbound shut near huntingdon by flooding
text: the westbound a14 is closed because of flooding between j21 , for the a1 at brampton hut , and j19 , for easton , and traffic is queuing in the area .
diversions are in operation up the a1 to peterborough and back down the a605 , past oundle to thrapston .
more details on bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: conference to tackle growing problem of cybercrime
text: a conference on cybercrime is taking place in cambridge today , organised by the county 's constabulary and police and crime commissioner sir graham bright .
police claim that half the population of england have been affected by it .

sir graham said : `` tackling cybercrime is a high priority for me but remains a challenge , as the nature of cybercrime is constantly evolving in both the complexity of the investigations and the creativity of cyber-criminals . ''
author: Dotty McLeod
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: weather : cloudy start but becoming dry and bright
text: it 's a cloudy start to the day , with perhaps the odd spot of rain or drizzle .
it will brighten up , with sunny spells developing but feeling chilly .
maximum temperature : 10c ( 50f ) .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: headlines : cybercrime tackled stephen hawking backs eu
text: headlines : cybercrime tackled stephen hawking backs eu
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: welcome to bbc cambridgeshire live
text: good morning and welcome to cambridgeshire live .
stay with us for the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates for the county until 18:00 .
you can get involved with our live page at any time .
send us your stories and via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Andrew Woodger
BBC News
